intro: Anticharis arabica, commonly known as the Arabian anticharis, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central column. Anticharis arabica is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments, often with deep root systems to access groundwater.
